009package _ImageJ_Examples;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016import java.awt.Rectangle;
017
018/**
019 * This ImageJ plugin shows how a subimage is extracted from
020 * a given image using the bounding box of the currently selected 
021 * region of interest (ROI). Note that the resulting image is
022 * of the same type as the original.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2020/12/17
026 */
027public class Roi_Extract_Subimage_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
028        boolean showMask = true;
029        
030        ImagePlus im = null;
031
032        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
033                this.im = im;
034                return DOES_ALL + ROI_REQUIRED;
035        }
036
037        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
038                Rectangle roi = ip.getRoi();
039                if (roi == null) {
040                        IJ.error("selection required!"); // this should not happen ever
041                        return;
042                }
043
044                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip.crop();
045                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-extracted", ip2).show();
046        }
047}
